verses.kjv: Awake, awake; put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city: for henceforth there shall no more come into thee the uncircumcised and the unclean.
verses.ct: Wake up, wake up! Clothe yourself in strength, Zion! Put on your finest clothing, Jerusalem, the holy city! From now on, no one who is ungodly or impure will ever enter you again.

verses.kjv: Shake thyself from the dust; arise, and sit down, O Jerusalem: loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.
verses.ct: Shake off the dust and rise up, Jerusalem! Free yourself from the chains around your neck, captive daughter of Zion.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD, Ye have sold yourselves for nought; and ye shall be redeemed without money.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: You were sold for nothing, and you will be bought back without money.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the Lord GOD, My people went down aforetime into Egypt to sojourn there; and the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: Long ago my people went down to Egypt to live there for a while, and later Assyria oppressed them for no reason.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, what have I here, saith the LORD, that my people is taken away for nought? they that rule over them make them to howl, saith the LORD; and my name continually every day is blasphemed.
verses.ct: So now what do I find here? says the LORD. My people have been carried off for nothing. Their rulers mock them, says the LORD, and my name is constantly insulted all day long.

verses.kjv: Therefore my people shall know my name: therefore they shall know in that day that I am he that doth speak: behold, it is I.
verses.ct: For this reason, my people will come to know my name. On that day they will recognize that I am the one who speaks — yes, it is I.

verses.kjv: How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace; that bringeth good tidings of good, that publisheth salvation; that saith unto Zion, Thy God reigneth!
verses.ct: How wonderful it is to see the messenger coming over the mountains, bringing good news, announcing peace, carrying word of good things, proclaiming salvation, and saying to Zion, "Your God is king!"

verses.kjv: Thy watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the voice together shall they sing: for they shall see eye to eye, when the LORD shall bring again Zion.
verses.ct: Your watchmen will raise their voices and shout for joy together, because they will witness it with their own eyes when the LORD restores Zion.

verses.kjv: Break forth into joy, sing together, ye waste places of Jerusalem: for the LORD hath comforted his people, he hath redeemed Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Burst into joyful singing together, you ruins of Jerusalem! The LORD has comforted his people; he has rescued Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: The LORD hath made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God.
verses.ct: The LORD has revealed his holy power in plain sight of every nation, and the farthest corners of the earth will witness the salvation of our God.

verses.kjv: Depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch no unclean thing; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean, that bear the vessels of the LORD.
verses.ct: Leave, leave! Get out of there! Don't touch anything impure. Come out from among her and purify yourselves, you who carry the vessels of the LORD.

verses.kjv: For ye shall not go out with haste, nor go by flight: for the LORD will go before you; and the God of Israel will be your rereward.
verses.ct: You will not have to leave in a rush or flee in panic, because the LORD will go ahead of you, and the God of Israel will guard you from behind.

verses.kjv: Behold, my servant shall deal prudently, he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.
verses.ct: Pay attention — my servant will act wisely. He will be raised up, lifted high, and greatly exalted.

verses.kjv: As many were astonied at thee; his visage was so marred more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men:
verses.ct: Just as many people were horrified at the sight of him — his appearance was disfigured beyond recognition, and his form no longer looked human —

verses.kjv: So shall he sprinkle many nations; the kings shall shut their mouths at him: for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they consider.
verses.ct: so he will startle many nations. Kings will stand speechless before him, because they will see what they were never told about, and they will grasp what they had never heard of.
